docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, May 9 -- An agreement establishing diplomatic relations between the Soviet Union and the Republic of Costa Rica has been signed by Constantine A. Oumansky, Soviet Ambassador, and Carlos Jinesta Munoz, Costa Rican Ambassador here, it was...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, May 9 -- An agreement establishing diplomatic relations between the Soviet Union and the Republic of Costa Rica has been signed by Constantine A. Oumansky, Soviet Ambassador, and Carlos Jinesta Munoz, Costa Rican Ambassador here, it was learned in diplomatic circles today.
docs.abstract: Agreement establishing tie with USSR signed; Mex aid noted

headline.main: COSTA RICA, RUSSIA IN DIPLOMATIC TIE; Pact Establishing Relations Is Signed -- 'Good Offices' of Mexico Facilitate Move

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, May 10 -- The death of the Brazilian Ambassador in Buenos Aires, Jose de Paula Rodrigues Alves, and the marked Pan-American character that the Argentine Government gave to his funeral have brought about a noticeable lessening of tension...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, May 10 -- The death of the Brazilian Ambassador in Buenos Aires, Jose de Paula Rodrigues Alves, and the marked Pan-American character that the Argentine Government gave to his funeral have brought about a noticeable lessening of tension in the relations between Argentina and those countries on this continent that have not recognized Gen. Edelmiro Farrell as the lawful successor of Gen. Pedro P. Ramirez in the Presidency.
docs.abstract: comment on Argentine declaration of 3 days mourning and other courtesies

docs.lead_paragraph: Detailed proposals for post-war economic and social cooperation among the American republics to promote industry, trade and employment, raise standards of living, and safeguard private enterprise, individual rights and world peace, will be presented by the United States delegation to the first Conference of Commissions of Inter-American Development, now in session at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel.

docs.lead_paragraph: Maj. Gen. Auguste Marie Brossin de St. Didier, chief of the French Military Mission to the United States, paid an official visit to Governors Island yesterday afternoon. Beurket, in command at Fort Jay.

docs.snippet: IT is good to welcome Catherine Littlefield to the ranks of American choreographers represented in the repertoire of the Ballet Theatre. She is one of the mere handful of people who have done most to prepare the field for the existence of a native...
docs.lead_paragraph: IT is good to welcome Catherine Littlefield to the ranks of American choreographers represented in the repertoire of the Ballet Theatre. She is one of the mere handful of people who have done most to prepare the field for the existence of a native ballet art.

docs.snippet: Many a news dispatch telling of the current political troubles of Argentina has a Montevideo dateline, as readers may have noted. The fact bears witness that the democratic spirit of little Uruguay is still dynamic and determined. The Uruguayans have...
docs.lead_paragraph: Many a news dispatch telling of the current political troubles of Argentina has a Montevideo dateline, as readers may have noted. The fact bears witness that the democratic spirit of little Uruguay is still dynamic and determined. The Uruguayans have had their share of the woes of the time.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 16 (Delayed) -- The new Argentine Foreign Minister, Gen. Orlando L. Peluffo, today received the heads of all the foreign diplomatic missions that continue to maintain relations with the present Argentine Government.

docs.snippet: Thirteen resolutions on international trade and seven on transportation, all designed to increase post-war commerce between the United States and Latin America, among the Latin-American republics, and with the world at large, were adopted yesterday...
docs.lead_paragraph: Thirteen resolutions on international trade and seven on transportation, all designed to increase post-war commerce between the United States and Latin America, among the Latin-American republics, and with the world at large, were adopted yesterday at committee meetings of the Conference of Commissions of Inter-American Development.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 17 -- The first step toward establishing special courts in Argentina for the settlement of labor disputes -- similar to those that existed in fascist Italy under the corporative regime -- was taken today when Col. Juan D....
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 17 -- The first step toward establishing special courts in Argentina for the settlement of labor disputes -- similar to those that existed in fascist Italy under the corporative regime -- was taken today when Col. Juan D. Peron, War Minister, in his capacity as Secretary of the Labor Department, ordered it to draw up "after necessary study a draft scheme for the organization of special labor courts."

headline.main: ARGENTINA PLANNING LABOR COURT SET-UP; Judicial Trend Held Similar to Italy's Under Mussolini
